name: Trump National Doral

reviews.text: Pros: Our room in Building 4 was on the second floor with a great view of the Blue Monster. The room was oversized with a balcony and chairs. Bath area had two sinks and a spacious counter. A new carpet would have been a plus, however.
reviews.title: The Doral = Once But Not Again
Unbelieveably Great!!
reviews.text: Cons: Dirty room service dishes are left in the stairwells all day and all night. Yuck! The fine dining restaurant is not spectacular - the service was painfully slow and inattentive. The spa is quite overpriced and rather forgetable. Golf is fine, but not worth the greens fee. It is an unforgettable experience, however, to play where the pros had just played.

reviews.title: Great bed/beautiful room
reviews.text: Would we go back - probably not. Are we glad we did? Yes, to say we've been there.

reviews.title: Bad, Bad and Bad
reviews.text: The resort was taken over by the Marriott Company a little while back and it shows. The service is 1st class, the rooms are BIG and beautiful. I can't say enough great things about this place. It is so nice that we actually bought a timeshare at the villas. Trust me, the older reviews are outdated. This place is fantastic and we can't wait to return.

reviews.title: Overrated Resort
reviews.text: Stayed at the Doral Golf Resort 1 night, Feb 19.

reviews.title: Not as bad as the reviews say
reviews.text: We were apprehensive about going to the resort after reading so many negative reviews. I have to say that we just returned from a very pleasant and relaxing mini vacation. We took advantage of a resort package and were treated to very nice spa treatments at the hotel. In fact, we loved the spa, the massages, the yoga class and the facials. Our package also included a very nice and delicious buffet breakfast. The hotel was rather empty and my kids were able to enjoy the pool almost all to themselves. The room was nice and spacious although yes, it is a bit dated. It is an old hotel and it shows. There were also some minuses. Just as some other reviews have noted, their reservation system is not very accurate. Our reservation was book incorrectly. It was fixed later on. The lunch buffet at Windows is nice for the eyes but not as wonderful on the palate or the pocket. It is very expensive and an automatic 20% tip was added to the lunch bill. It turned out to be close to $80.00 for two people. Some staff members (Lorena) were extremely nice and helpful. Others could take a few hints from her.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Way overdue for a total restoration, The Trump organization takes over The Doral either today or tomorrow. This resort with its stellar golf courses should have been upgraded to JW Marriott standards years ago but I imagine that the owner of the property wasn't willing to spend the big bucks to do so. The Donald has bought the property with his typical hype at making it fabulous.
reviews.title: Time warp resort changes hands today

reviews.text: We stayed there on weekend of June 2-4th and found the place rather sad. We had a great meal at Mezasul and I had a fairly standard experience at the Pritikin spa but the weekend was nothing to write home about. My husband played golf for two days and said the courses were in good shape but were definitely showing their age. Trump was able to keep the Cadillac tournament here next spring, so I imagine the resort will be trying to ready themselves for this.
reviews.title: Great for golf - that's it!

reviews.text: Rooms are from the 60's and the updating done of the past years has been half-as-ed at best. Nothing to give you a clue about being at one of the premier golf courses in America. Just Interstate Standard Marriott quality...
reviews.title: Perfect for Golf. Excellent service.

reviews.text: I think all reviews until the grand opening will be sort of worthless as changes as made. The trump organization has little experience with a golf institution as complex as this one is. Fingers are crossed.
reviews.title: Good experience when getting a good deal and need to be in the area

reviews.text: I was booked for 3 nights at the Doral last month to attend an industry conference. When I arrived, the host at the front desk told me they had no record of my reservation, which didn't make sense since I showed proof that I was registered for the conference and the hotel reservation was part of the conference reservation. In any case, they were able to find a room for 2 nights but then I would need to vacate as the hotel was fully booked afterwards. The manager on duty was not available so I left a copy of my registration form and was told they would look into it and let me know. Later, I received a phone message that the manager stated the copy I left showed no proof that the hotel had made the reservation and that I would need to vacate the property following my second night stay. I went to the front desk and spoke to the manager on duty, explaining this was my fourth stay at the hotel, I was a Marriott reward member and that my company was sponsoring a dinner at the property for 400 guests. The manager proceeded to tell me that the property was fully booked but would honor my full stay if I showed proof that the hotel was at fault for not booking my reservation. I once again showed my registration form and explained that either the hotel or the conference coordinator messed up my reservation and asked that they find a room for that last night. If they could find a room if I showed proof then it's obvious I could be accomodated. The manager gave a very stern "No" and when I asked how would it be possible to find a room if I had other evidence, I was told "I could make it happen". Obviously, this conversation was going nowhere so I complained to the conference coordinator who was able to have my stay extended for that one last night. After all this, there was no apology from the hotel or any offer to compensate for the experience. I would have accepted free wi-fi, which was ridiculously overpriced and slow. I ended using my Sprint air card!
reviews.title: A good place for families

reviews.text: as said before sub standard rooms for i would call a five star hotel if as they say that the new owner mr trump is going to up grade them it will go back to being a great hotel.that was the down side of our stay.when it came to service the staff was great nothing to much trouble.the golf on all the courses was very very good indeed,the staff at the buggy park,the starters,the cadies where great, nothing was to much trouble well done to you all.we had six games of golf in four days as it was a inter bank match the doral person running all for us was there for two days and done a bloody great job looking after us.the sunday evening meal sit down again well done to the staff,also our friday night golf shop drinks and food again we where looked after very well.mr trump your staff you have taken over you will not get better why i think is that they like their jobs.
reviews.title: great golf good sevice

reviews.text: I will say, the stay has been relentlessly apologetic about the occurrences during my stay. Top notch staff that is very nice and accommodating - however, they are representing a property that deserved to be torn down.
reviews.title: Resort should be bulldoozed. Cockroach in room. Flooding.

reviews.text: Night one - arrived at 1:30AM after flight delays and walk into my ground floor room to be greeted by a cockroach running across the bathroom floor. I promptly move rooms and arrive to a my next room that is cockroach free (at least as far as I can tell) but there is a dirty glass filled with old coca cola sitting on the bathroom sink. The carpet in the room is stained. The whole hotel smells funny.
reviews.title: Sub Par guest rooms

reviews.text: Day two - a standard afternoon Florida rain shower occurs. I enter the hotel and promptly step in a one inch puddle as the entire floor has become flooded.
reviews.title: Needs updating..but clearly a mecca for golfers.
DON'T BE DETERRED! This is a great stay for anyone!
reviews.text: The conference facilities do not have restroom large enough to accommodate big groups. If it rains room service closes and you must go outside in the rain to get any food.

Stayed here on business July 16-18. Learned that the resort was purchased by Trump June 1. Property grounds are beautiful but room / lodges are dated (built in 60's). My room was good but you could see the ware over the years. My co-worker had a nicer room so you may want to ask for Lodge 1 or 2. I was in 9/10. Staff was very helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: Average Rooms beautiful property

reviews.text: I had been to this hotel approx 5 years ago & remember loving it. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms spacious. However there were a few issues during this stay. When I attempted to check in, they did not have my rsvp. After several attempts to locate it, I finally had to provide my rsvp confirmation. They just gave me an available room @ the rate on my confirmation. I left the printed confirmation with them. Unfortunately as it wasn't yet check-in time, our rooms (we were travelling with another couple I'd booked also) were not yet ready. They offered to call me when our room was ready, which should be about an hour. We headed to the poolside snack bar & enjoyed delicious drinks & snacks. After 2 hours, we decided to check if perhaps our rooms were ready & they hadn't called. Our room was ready, and our friends was not. Not good. Essentially, I think it was confused front desk staff (perhaps new since the switch?) that did not understand who to give rooms to? I don't know. After expressing their discontent, my friends room was also ready. Our room was lovely, beautiful view, comfortable bed. Unfortunately there was so little shower pressure, i ended up rinsing my head under the tub faucet. Other than that, the room was great & the maid was excellent. Our second day there, we returned to our room to find construction going on outside it. Half the length of the hallway was coated in plastic, including above our door. About 7 workers were busy, very polite & apologetic. Not the prettiest experience though. Upon leaving, the hotel attempted to charge me for our room (which had been paid previously). Clearly due to the complication of the missing rsvp in the first place, they also had no record of it being paid for (& sadly, no note of the conf I'd left them with). In the end, we were not charged, but all in all...I hope they are soon through this transitional stage. Once it is through, this will be a beautiful place to stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful, but in transition

reviews.text: This is a great hotel - very friendly, helpful staff. We arrived several hous early & they made sure we were able to check in within 15 min. of our arrival time. The resort is across the street from the famous Doral golf course, a pleasant walk. We had dinner there one evening on the 18th hole. Fabulous food! Not too far from the airport & restaurants. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Doral Golf Resort - Miami

reviews.text: My girlfriend took me to this spa for my birthday. We started our day with a tour of the spa, the lady who showed us around was very nice. We decided we would go to the pool, float and eat lunch.
reviews.title: This Spa is Tired...fix it Mr. Trump!!

reviews.text: At first we were the only ones at the pool...so it took a minute to place an order. We ordered 2 salads and wine. The salads were really big and yummy!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location!!

reviews.text: Went on a one week golf trip with group of 4. The courses were excellent as was the facility but the best part of this trip was the attention of the staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Venue

reviews.text: Nothing was too much trouble and they were always happy and cheerful. Very attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. This covered everyone from cleaners, aterers, table staff, golf starters, pro shop and buggy organisers.
reviews.title: Golf Vacation

reviews.text: We would certainly visit there again.
reviews.title: Just there for a convention

reviews.text: Overall this was a fun resort. The rooms are dated but the balconies are excellent. Lots of shops and excellent restaurants.
reviews.title: Exceptional Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were just there this past week for a convention. I found the place to be very lovely. We were a little worried with what we would find since Trump just bought the place and what would happen as they transended into new ownership. We were pleasantly surprised that it turned out to be very nice. Our room had a few problems when we checked in, a dirty hand towel on the sink and a wet spon on the carpet by the window but other than that it was clean. They do have a slight problem with the housekeeping not getting to your room early, ours was not cleaned until around 4 to 5pm which was a problem some days because we needed it to get ready for dinners and parties in the eveings. The pool area was very nice but it rained most of the time we were there and we only used it one afternoon for an hour or so.
reviews.title: Nice stay
looks nice but no life-only for relaxing - tan and sleep and spend big on food
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were looking to get away for memorial day weekend- we wanted to relax and see the nightlife, thinking we were going to be in the middle of miami- mistake #1- nowhere near the beaches or miami- it is actually on a highway off of miami - you need a minimum $20 taxi ride to find some signs of life- dont get me wrong, it is a very pretty place and has a nice pool- but thats it! it looks pretty, it is clean, but if you arent a golfer, you are going straight to bed after the pool- we're 22 and 25- thats what we did! couldnt find one nightclub in the area, and when we said we want transportation to ft lauderdale the conserge insisted it was too far and we'd pay a fortune for taxi- well we rented a car on the second day to realize that all the nearby towns including ft. lauderdale itself was less than half hour away- it doesnt pay to use taxis- rent a car or stay in the whole time! oh and do not eat at windows! our waiter forgot one of the meals, even though it is common sense one person is eating and one is not! instead of apologizing- he said: "what, they forgot to bring it? do you still want it now?" we said no, took our $8 bottle of water and left. they do not apologize because tip is automatically on your bill! too many hidden costs! the sports bar downstairs is pretty cheap and casual, half the price than windows upstairs! too bad we discovered it too late! we did relax and tan over all, so it was worth it for me- if you want to go to party in miami or go to the beach, this resort is not for you!

reviews.title: Stay away - far away!!
reviews.text: To say that this venue is a disappointment is an understatement! My company had a meeting there two weeks ago. I was concerned before we even got there as I felt while planning the meeting that the staff really didn't care about us or the meeting. The staff just does not seem to be happy about their jobs. i learned later that the Marriott Hotels are buying the hotel and key people have left or are leaving which is maybe why this problem exists. The registration process was a disaster which meant our meeting started off on the wrong foot. Food was average at best. We have had better food at lower priced hotels. Service was really poor. We had flagged only 2 of our 70 guests as VIPs hoping that they would get the best service. They did not and in fact I found myself apologizing to them. A few of our people golfed and said that the course was nice but not "amazing" as the reviews would indicate - and the prices are steep for golf. The spa was great we have no complaints. Restaurant service was a bit better than the service in other aspects of the hotel. The pool had too many kids to really enjoy. I just have to say overall this was a very disappointing experience and will never go back.

aka: Doral Golf Resort And Spa, a Marriott Hotel Doral
description: An expansive resort in sunny South Florida, built around the legacy of golf. Enjoy gourmet dining in the new Mesazul Steakhouse or simply relax at the Bossa Nova Lounge. Make it an extended stay in our fabulous accommodations, explore our retail shops and discover all there is to love at Doral Golf Resort & Spa Miami, a Trump managed resort
